intro: Lapsana communis subsp. grandiflora, commonly known as the greater everlasting or common cudweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has finely divided, grass-like leaves and is often found in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields. It is native to Europe but has been introduced to other parts of the world. The species is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
